intro: Gutenbergia cordifolia var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf gutenbergia, is a species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its leaves are usually glossy and dark green, while the flowers range in color from violet to deep red, often attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
